name: French Quarter Beignets
author: Dale Tadlock
summary: If you can't get to New Orleans, try this recipe to recreate these beignets. They can't be beat with a cup of coffee! Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.
ingredients: ½ cup warm water (110 degrees F (43 degrees C))
directions: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a large bowl
Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes
Add milk, sugar, egg, oil, vanilla extract, and salt to the yeast
Mix until a sticky dough forms
Place 1 portion on a heavily floured surface
Roll to about 1/8-inch thickness using a well floured rolling pin
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 370 degrees F (188 degrees C)
Fry beignets, a few at a time, until they puff and rise to the top, 2 to 3 minutes
Turn and brown the other side, 1 to 2 minutes
